That’s how a war of mutual destruction works : Both sides feel under siege ; both believe themselves to be the victim ; neither shows any mercy .

sent1: A U.S. military commission convicted Hamdan of terrorism support , sentencing him to 5.5 years , with credit for time at Guantanamo , marking first war crimes trial since WWII .
sent2: When a jury in the U.S. District Court for the District of Columbia found Hamdan guilty on August 6 , it became the first time that a war crimes trial had been completed by a military commission since World War II . The tribunal acquitted him on one count and deadlocked on another . However , Hamdan was convicted of providing material support for terrorism and the judge sentenced him to five and a half years in prison . He will also be eligible for credit for his time served at Guantanamo Bay since he was captured .

sent1: Post - recession , American shoppers crave discounts , delaying purchases for deeper markdowns , causing prolonged retail price declines and stagnant sales .
sent2: American shoppers , burned by the recession and feeling the pinch of a slow recovery , have become addicted to discounts . They are holding out for bigger sales before they buy — or simply not buying at all unless it is at a steep markdown . The result has been one of the longest and most pronounced declines in retail prices since the 1930 s , leaving stores struggling with flat or lower sales .

sent1: Marie - Lou Desage , born in Mulhouse , moved to Brussels in 2015 . After years as an independent jeweler , she studied at La Cambre at 34 to master fabrication , empowering her designs and calling it her best decision .
sent2: Born in Mulhouse , France , designer Marie - Lou Desage has lived and worked in Brussels since 2015 . She began her career working for a few years as an independent jewelry designer , but she soon realized that she would have more control over the design process if she learned to fabricate her own pieces . In order to do so , she enrolled in La Cambre’s jewelry program . " I wanted to be able to see my ideas come to life without having to rely on someone else , ” she says . " It was a challenge to go back to school at age 34 , but it’s been one of the best decisions I ever made . ”

sent1: Plant - based diets use more groundwater than meat - heavy ones due to water - intensive crops like nuts and legumes , despite common assumptions .
sent2: As dinner tables and supermarket shelves are stocked with more foods from plants , it’s important to consider how our choices affect the water supply . A new study published in Environmental Research Letters shows that a typical vegetarian diet requires 320 gallons of groundwater per day , while a meat - rich diet needs just 170 gallons . The reason is simple : it takes a lot of water to grow crops , especially ones high in protein like nuts and legumes .

sent1: Alice Könitz’s " Beyond Utopia " explores artistic escapes , inspired by Lucy Lippard’s 1967 essay on post - WWII freedom , Happenings , Fluxus , and anti - market conceptual art .
sent2: " Beyond Utopia , ” a new show of drawings and sculptures by the Los Angeles artist Alice Könitz , is not about utopias . It is about exits . The title refers to an essay from 1967 by the art critic Lucy Lippard , " Escape Attempts” ( or " Ausstiegsversuche” in its original German ) . In it , Ms. Lippard coined the phrase " Beyond Utopia” to describe the impulse toward individual liberty that had taken hold of artists since World War II . This was the age of Happenings , Fluxus and conceptual art — or what she called " concept - art . ” Ms. Lippard wrote admiringly of these movements’ efforts to free art from the marketplace ,

sent1: Beckmann , a celebrated Berlin artist , flourished before the war . After Hitler’s rise , he was labeled " degenerate , " fired , and banned from creating or exhibiting art .
sent2: Before the war , Beckmann had been at the peak of his career . He was a prominent figure in Berlin’s art scene and widely admired for his skill as a draftsman and painter , for his self - confidence , and for his charismatic personality . His works were included in all the major exhibitions of modern art throughout Europe . But after Hitler came to power , Beckmann was branded a " degenerate artist . ” He was fired from his job teaching at the Frankfurt Städel School . And he was forbidden to paint or exhibit his work .

That’s because Israel is afraid that Hamas will smuggle weapons and other contraband into Gaza in order to continue its terrorist activities against Israel . The only way to prevent this from happening is to inspect every single item of aid before it is allowed to cross into Gaza . It takes a lot of time and effort to do this , which explains why the aid has not been getting through as quickly as everyone would like .

sent1: The holiday season brings joy , travel , and risks . Google Maps helps you navigate safely , reducing stress and accidents during busy travel times .

In fact , the National Safety Council estimates that over 430 people could be killed on our roads in December alone as a result of car crashes caused by drunk driving , speeding , texting or other dangerous behaviors . sent2: Sweden moved one step closer to joining NATO on Wednesday after a majority of lawmakers backed efforts by the center - left minority government to sign a partnership deal with the alliance . The non - binding resolution means Sweden can start accession talks with NATO that could eventually lead to full membership of the U.S. - led alliance after years of heated political debate in the country . " This is an important signal from parliament , " Prime Minister Stefan Lofven told reporters after the vote , adding that he would now contact NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg to formally begin the accession process . sent1: We bought a Christmas tree , donated to plant more , but forgot it could’ve been replanted—just needed to return it outside to grow again .
sent2: A few years ago , my husband and I were shopping for a Christmas tree at the local Home Depot . After we paid for it , the cashier asked if we wanted to donate money to support the planting of more trees . We gave her our money , but then realized that there was no need to plant new trees—all she needed to do was take our tree back outside . Our tree could have been replanted and grown again !

sent1: Loan terms undisclosed in 1991 confirmation forms ; senators say knowledge might have changed their confirmation votes .
sent2: The terms of the loan were not disclosed when Justice Thomas filled out financial forms for his Supreme Court confirmation hearings in 1991 . The senators who reviewed the documents said that if they had known about the loan , they might have voted differently on whether to confirm him .

sent1: " The Sweet East " by Stephen Metcalfe portrays late 1960 s America—innocent , traditional , and fading—now replaced by a darker , destructive era .
sent2: " The Sweet East , ” a new play by Stephen Metcalfe , is set in a time and place that are no longer with us . It was the late 1960 s , when the world was still ruled by men who wore suits to work and didn’t leave their wives for younger women . It was also a time of relative innocence ; one character describes it as " a sweet east wind that blew across America . ” That wind has now changed into something darker and more destructive — an ill wind that blows nobody any good . sent1: She won . There 's nothing more to say . Simple , clear , final .
sent2: " So , well , there’s not much to say . She won . ”

sent1: Clallam County , Washington , consistently opposes same - sex marriage in its voting patterns .
sent2: Clallam County in the state of Washington has been voting against same - sex marriage for a long time .

sent1: Democratic governors met in Philadelphia to strategize against Trump , receiving guidance on avoiding mistakes in their campaigns .
sent2: America’s Democratic governors gathered in Philadelphia to talk about how to beat President Donald Trump — but the potential candidates were also given some advice on how not to lose .

sent1: Mat Honan’s Wired article reveals how Google searches expose personal details , raising privacy concerns despite the information being harmless .
sent2: In the most recent issue of Wired magazine ( March 2015 ) , there is an article by Mat Honan entitled , " Love Letter : When Google Search Reveals Too Much " . It 's a great read about how our lives are revealed through search results . I encourage you to check it out . The article focuses on how a Google search for his name reveals a lot of personal information about him . It 's not necessarily bad stuff - just stuff that he would prefer be private and confidential .

sent1: In " Oppenheimer , " Emily Blunt portrays Kitty Oppenheimer , unbothered by needing to be likable , focusing instead on authenticity .
sent2: In " Oppenheimer , ” the new film about J. Robert Oppenheimer , the father of the atomic bomb , Emily Blunt plays Kitty Oppenheimer , his wife . As Blunt explains to WWD , she didn’t really care whether her character was likable or not .

sent1: Astrid Delgado learned early that race mattered when her father urged her to label herself " Latina " on a test , revealing the unspoken expectations she’d overlooked .
sent2: Astrid Delgado first learned that she might have to work harder than her white classmates when she was in middle school and took an exam for a private high school . When the results came back , her father was upset to learn that his daughter had scored 90 percent or higher on all but one part of the test — where she got only 51 percent . The section asked students to choose words from a list that best described themselves . Ms. Delgado , who is now 23 , said she chose " shy” because it seemed like the right answer .
